--- title: "\U0001F9B8 The Company of Heroes" date: 2021-12-11 date-modified: "2025-07-30" order: 10 tags: - Cooperation - Defection - Prisoners` Dilemma - Regret, Reward, Risk, Retribution editor_options: markdown: wrap: 72 --- #### Who is a Stranger? ![](featured.jpg){width="100%" height="50%" fig-align="center"} ## Introduction: The Company of Strangers! How many strangers do you "meet" everyday? Why is the Human Species different from all others? Those two questions are not unrelated !! The Human Species is perhaps unique in that we are able to [cooperate with strangers](https://fee.org/media/4316/547_42.pdf)!! Yes! Do you think that designing things, building and conducting a business, or making art is something like that? No? Well, let us see a few quick stories!! ## Story-1 ### Do you know who these four people are ? ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Dartagnan-musketeers.jpg/512px-Dartagnan-musketeers.jpg){width=350px} ::: ::: ### The Hero's Journey
This is the story of a young man who leaves home from Tarbes, in Gascony, France, to travel to Paris to make his fortune. He has two blessings,one each from his mother and his father. True to the instructions given by his Dad, and his very Gascon nature, [he picks a fight even before he reaches Paris.](https://youtu.be/KXvzAvOL5GI) ### Classic Movie Time! Let us watch a (very very) small part of this movie, [The Three ~~Pangas~~ Musketeers-1973](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Three_Musketeers_(1973_live-action_film)). Here is the [IMDB page](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0072281/) for film buffs. and this order version: ### Classic Fiction Time! Let us read aloud(!) a bit of good old classic fiction !! This is the Conversation that occurs right before the duel scene we saw in the video above. [**Chapter 5. THE KING'S MUSKETEERS AND THE CARDINAL'S GUARDS**](https://www.gutenberg.org/files/1257/1257-h/1257-h.htm).[^1] Keep an eye on the conversation! And an ear open for French-ified English, I beseech you!! Here is the audio reading of this chapter from [Librivox.org](https://librivox.org/the-three-musketeers-by-alexandre-dumas/)

### Discussion-1 - ["When have to shoot, shoot! Don't talk!"](https://youtu.be/JrYtD7gSWsI?feature=shared) said [Eli Wallach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eli_Wallach). - Pardon,m'sieu, but why were they so polite to each other? (Oh, These French...) - Were they talking as if they didn't want to fight? - But to "have fought already"? - The **Shadow of the Future** ## Story-2 What about this game ? ### Discussion-2 What **emotions** or **motivations** are portrayed by the characters in the story? We can think of the "4Rs": - Reward - Regret aka FOMO - Risk - Retribution/Punishment ### Nice Guys Finish First {{< video https://youtube.com/watch?v=rr6lsTgZKAQ >}} ## [Wait, But Why?](https://waitbutwhy.com) - Many public behaviours require us to *trust* strangers - We have Rule of Law based on this trust - If there is no **C** at first, then everybody does a **D** - That is the source of the **Dilemma** - As Artists and Designers, and Creators, we need to practice our craft that in such a way as to induce *niceness*... - So what will you make? A movie? An ad? A public sign-board? A street play? An illustration? A "spatial arrangement"? A policy or a law? ## References 1. John D.
